definition: colloquial term for 生肖[sheng1 xiao4] the animals associated with the years of a 12-year cycle
category/genus (taxonomy)/family members/dependents/to belong to/subordinate to/affiliated with/be born in the year of (one of the 12 animals)/to be/to prove to be/to constitute
to join together/to fix one's attention on/to concentrate on
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
birth year as designated by animal symbols (mouse, ox, tiger etc)

sentences.english: The most venerated of Chinese zodiac deities , the dragon, has traditionally been a symbol of water.
sentences.chinese: 傳說作爲中國人最崇拜的十二屬相之一的龍代表着水。

sentences.english: Although my animal zodiac is pig, I don't want to act like one.
sentences.chinese: 儘管我的屬相是豬，我可不像表現得像它一樣。

sentences.english: The Chinese animal signs are a 12-year cycle used for dating the years.
sentences.chinese: 十二屬相就是用來紀年的一個十二年的循環。

sentences.english: With these traditions, the Chinese lunar zodiac calendar plays a big role.
sentences.chinese: 按照傳統，中國的屬相同樣也是一個重要的角色。

sentences.english: A person's animal sign is connected to his or her birth year.
sentences.chinese: 一個人的動物屬相是連接到他或她的出生年份。

sentences.english: Tigers are chiefly known for their bravery, but they also tend to be one of the flashier signs.
sentences.chinese: 屬虎的人主要以勇敢著稱，但是虎也是愛炫耀的屬相。

sentences.english: The lunar calendar designates one of 12 zodiac signs to each year.
sentences.chinese: 按陰曆的說法，每年十二屬相中的“生肖年”。

sentences.english: I got angry at first, but then I realized he was talking about my Chinese Zodiac symbol.
sentences.chinese: 一開始我很生氣，後來才知道，他說的是我的屬相。

sentences.english: Do you know which animal signs are best paired with people born in the Year of Rabbit?
sentences.chinese: 你知道屬兔的人和什麼屬相的人最配嗎？

definition: solar calendar/Western (Gregorian) calendar
one's fortune (in astrology)
bustling/energetic

one's age, according to the traditional Chinese method of reckoning (i.e. the number of Chinese calendar years in which one has lived). In this system, a person's age is one year at birth, and increases by one year at the beginning of the first solar term 立春[Li4 chun1] each year, rather than on one's birthday./as opposed to 足歲|足岁[zu2 sui4]/see also 實歲|实岁[shi2 sui4]
to err/to get sth wrong/to miscalculate/to misunderstand
horoscope/one's fortune
lunar calendar
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
natal chart (astrology)
for reference only
all one's hopes and efforts come to nothing/futile
time/one of the 12 two-hour periods of the day
little mistake/minor offense/slightly too much
civilian post (as opposed to military)/civil service/administration
parentheses/brackets
to be in a bad mood
